description.plain:
Simbi “Little Simz” Ajikawo (born February 23, 1994) is a British rapper, singer and actress from Islington, London. She also plays drums, guitar and bass.

Born in Islington, London to Nigerian parents, in her teens Ajikawo acted in the BBC children’s series Spirit Warriors, originally broadcast in 2010, and in the E4 television series, Youngers.

In parallel with her acting, she started her music career in 2010, releasing the mixtape STRATOSPHERE.

On September 18, 2015 she released her debut album A Curious Tale of Trials + Persons through her independent label, Age 101.

On December 16, 2016 she released her second studio album Stillness in Wonderland, which was inspired by Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland.

On November 3, 2017 she released a Deluxe Edition of Stilness In Wonderland including 8 new tracks.

On March 1, 2019 she released her third studio album GREY Area. The album delves into her life through her twenties, which she claims feels like a “grey area” – a situation that is not clear or where the rules are not known.

Simz is part of collective SPACE AGE along with Josh Arcé, Chuck 20 and Tilla Arcé (aka Tilladotocom). She has released all her music on her own label, Age 101 Music.

songs.title: Venom

description.plain:
“Venom” is a feminist, mental health anthem by rapper Little Simz. This song went viral on the popular social media app Tiktok in April 2021 the videos are usually based around feminism, typically on the line:

It’s a woman’s world, so to speak. Pussy, you sour. Never givin' credit where it’s due ‘cause you don’t like pussy in power.

The song was featured in the soundtrack of the British Netflix show Top Boy which Simz played the role of Shelly, a mother and the girlfriend of a gang leader Dushane.

songs.title: Backseat

description.plain:
In this song, which comes almost 6 months after her second full length album, Stillness In Wonderland, Little Simz speaks on where she’s at mentally and offers fans some explanation as to where she’s been.

The theme of this song continues from Stillness In Wonderland, which was somewhat of a concept album which spoke on mental health.

We can notice that the song is built in an assonance on the vowel sound “e”.

songs.title: Introvert

description.plain:
Delving deep into her British-Nigerian roots, Simz' bold, politically awakening single elucidates her inner turmoil, ensuring she never shies away from her poetic vulnerability, reminiscent of the album’s predecessor, GREY Area, released back in March 2019.

Simz continues to fight on with her battle to tackle the national government’s corruption and lust for money – no matter if their profits are to the detriment of others – along with the prejudiced calamities a Black woman faces in a time of crisis all around the world. When asked by i-D in April 2021 what she wanted listeners to take away from the light she had shed on the social injustices emphasised in the song, she replied:

People can take away whatever they feel, I think that’s the beautiful thing about art. It’s open for interpretation and whatever resonates with you the most will stick. So I kinda just like to leave it open, I’ve spoken my truth.

Effortlessly, the song as a whole is driven by a mighty cinematic fanfare and a powerful drum-line, as if it were something no short of a triumphant rally cry with an unwavering message: with unity comes strength, and with strength comes a war we must face if change is ever to be brought about, now more than ever.

songs.title: Woman

description.plain:
“Woman,” the second single from Little Simz’s sophomore album Sometimes I Might Be Introvert, is a track in homage to the women that inspire Simz on the daily.

Woven into the showers of compliments and praise are several allusions to largely populated areas of people of colour, including many countries throughout Africa, as well as Jamaica, India, and Brooklyn, New York.

In keeping with Simz’s writing, each line offers a deeper perspective into the ways that women have aided in uplifting certain cultures, industries, and influences. Incorporating political innuendos into her work is nothing new for Simz – in fact, she commented on how natural her writing process is during a March 2019 interview with DJ Magazine:

Everything I do happens on the spot. I was doing this when I was 15/16, so tapping into those subjects and those places and going back to those days was not difficult. Sometimes you’ve just got to put yourself back in that place mentally, and see what happens. As much as I’m a person that is aware of what’s happening in the world, I can still very much be in my own bubble, where I shut off completely from what’s happening, because I’m someone that really takes things on, and it actually effects me. So sometimes, I have to make the decision to remove myself. I know I have a platform and I know I need to touch on things that I believe need to be heard

songs.title: 101 FM

description.plain:
On “101 FM,” Simz reminisces her early life and come up in the U.K rap game. It was the third single from her third studio album and was premiered on Apple Music’s Beats 1 Radio by Julie Adenuga.
https://twitter.com/LittleSimz/status/1069913875175350274

The Inflo–produced track features an East Asian influenced instrumental and the title is a reference to her Age 101 label, crew and creative empire.

The self-shot Black and White cover art features two people on a BMX bicycle spotting retro fashion, which is reflective of the song’s nostalgic theme.

songs.title: Wings

description.plain:
This track, produced by IAMNOBODI, was released as a teaser to her debut album A Curious Tale Of Trials + Persons. However, following its release, Little Simz insisted that:

Wings’ isn’t a ‘lead single,’ it’s a mission statement.

“Wings” covers Little Simz' development as an artist and as a person, how she’s dealing with new-found fame and how she’s gotten where she is today.

songs.title: Offence

description.plain:
“Offence” is the first single off Simz third studio album GREY AREA. It was released on September 17, 2018 and was premiered as the World Record on Apple Music’s beats 1 with Zane Lowe.
https://twitter.com/Beats1/status/1041508097888382977

The song is produced by Inflo and features prominent drums as well as heavy live instrumentation which she explained during the premiere:

I guess this is my first project where I’ve kind of worked with only real live instrumentation. And for ‘Offence’ anyway, I wanted it to feel very unapologetic, very ballsy and  think times like this especially… It’s not time to be silent."

She flexes her lyrical ability and sounds off the haters and detractors while alluding to not care who she offends in unapologetic fashion.

The music video, directed by Charlie Di Placido and Josh Lloyd Watson of the band Jungle, was released on October 3, 2018.

songs.title: Boss

description.plain:
“Boss” is the second single from the album. Released on September 23, 2018, the Inflo–produced track finds Simz asserting her position as the boss following her success. The song made its debut on the HBO hit series INSECURE on this episode.

The official video, shot by Jeremy Cole was released on November 15, 2018. Speaking to DIY Magazine, this is what he said about the video:

For ‘Boss’ I wanted to make something with Simz that felt immediate and striking without any gimmicks. On the track it’s just Simz, so I wanted to showcase her performance directly. I wanted it to feel classic. We shot on 16mm, digital and tape so the aesthetic was layered but simple.

Additionally, Little Simz was heavily involved as she shot the cover art and hand wrote the lyrics that appear on the lyric video.

body.plain:
“Boss” is the second single from the album. Released on September 23, 2018, the Inflo–produced track finds Simz asserting her position as the boss following her success. The song made its debut on the HBO hit series INSECURE on this episode.

The official video, shot by Jeremy Cole was released on November 15, 2018. Speaking to DIY Magazine, this is what he said about the video:

For ‘Boss’ I wanted to make something with Simz that felt immediate and striking without any gimmicks. On the track it’s just Simz, so I wanted to showcase her performance directly. I wanted it to feel classic. We shot on 16mm, digital and tape so the aesthetic was layered but simple.

Additionally, Little Simz was heavily involved as she shot the cover art and hand wrote the lyrics that appear on the lyric video.

songs.title: Wounds

description.plain:
On “Wounds,” Little Simz and Chronixx collaborate for the second time, the first being on December 2016’s “LMPD.”

Over the soulful instrumental by Inflo, Simz details possession and usage of guns by the youth in society mainly due to peer influence, as well as the effects and consequences—facing the law or death. Unlike rappers that portray and exaggerate a violent street image, she insists on living a life that’s true to oneself.

On the final verse, she narrates the story of her friend that was stabbed to death by his friend-turned rival over a woman in January 2018.
